private_information: I can only manipulate vowel-labelled blocks (A, E, I).
I can only interact with the top block of any stack.
I can only move one block at a time.
vowel_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, and N on the table.

private_information: I can only manipulate consonant-labelled blocks (K, N, H, B, L, J, D, G, C, M, F).
I can only interact with the top block of any stack.
I can only move one block at a time.
consonant_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, and N on the table.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the partial analyses from the agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem tailored for the FastDownwards planner that achieves the global block rearrangement goal.

public_information: Blocks present: K, A, E, N, H, B, I, L, J, D, G, C, M, F.
Initial configuration: K is on the table.
Initial configuration: A is on the table.
Initial configuration: E is on the table.
Initial configuration: N is on top of E.
Initial configuration: H is on top of K.
Initial configuration: B is on top of H.
Initial configuration: I is on top of N.
Initial configuration: L is on top of A.
Initial configuration: J is on top of I.
Initial configuration: D is on top of L.
Initial configuration: G is on top of D.
Initial configuration: C is on top of B.
Initial configuration: M is on top of G.
Initial configuration: F is on top of J.
Only top blocks of stacks can be moved and agents can move only one block at a time.

Goal configuration: A is on top of B, B is on top of C, C is on top of D, D is on top of E, E is on top of F, F is on top of G, G is on top of H, H is on top of I, I is on top of J, J is on top of K, K is on top of L, L is on top of M, M is on top of N, and N is on the table.

analyze.system_prompt: You are a specialist agent that may only manipulate vowel-labelled blocks. Do not emit PDDL. Analyze the public environment and your private information and produce a structured report identifying which stacks have vowel blocks at the top, which vowel blocks you can legally move (block id and current support), what legal destination types are available for those blocks (table or top of which top-blocks), and any conflicts or sequencing constraints you observe. Your output should be a concise, machine-readable description named partial_vowel.
analyze.prompt: Agent name: vowel_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Private information: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Provide a step-by-step analysis and produce the structured report partial_vowel describing available moves, constraints, and any assumptions you require the orchestrator to resolve. Do not produce PDDL.

analyze.system_prompt: You are a specialist agent that may only manipulate consonant-labelled blocks. Do not emit PDDL. Analyze the public environment and your private information and produce a structured report identifying which stacks have consonant blocks at the top, which consonant blocks you can legally move (block id and current support), what legal destination types are available for those blocks (table or top of which top-blocks), and any conflicts or sequencing constraints you observe. Your output should be a concise, machine-readable description named partial_consonant.
analyze.prompt: Agent name: consonant_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Private information: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Provide a step-by-step analysis and produce the structured report partial_consonant describing available moves, constraints, and any assumptions you require the orchestrator to resolve. Do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and planning for the FastDownwards planner. You must integrate the partial reports from the two agents and the public environment to produce a single complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem that encodes the multi-agent block manipulation task while keeping agent actions distinct (e.g., separate action schemas or agent predicates). Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The produced PDDL must be compatible with FastDownwards and explicitly list objects, initial state, goal, and action schemas that respect the top-only and vowel/consonant movement constraints.
pddl.prompt: You receive two structured reports from agents and the public environment. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Vowel agent report: {partial_vowel}. Consonant agent report: {partial_consonant}. Orchestrate these inputs, resolve naming or reference mismatches, and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownwards that achieves the global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Keep the agents' actions distinct and ensure the model enforces top-only access and the vowel/consonant restrictions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
